completed_at.description: The datetime when deposit was completed..

created_at.description: The datetime when deposit was created.

id.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy,where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quotecurrency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets canbe found at /api/v2/markets.

Member.description: Get your profile and accounts info.

avg_price.description: Average execution price, average of price in trades.

created_at.description: Order create time in iso8601 format.

market.description: The market in which the order is placed, e.g. 'btcusd'.All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

price.description: Price for each unit. e.g.If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 usd, the price is '3000.0'

state.description: One of 'wait', 'done', or 'cancel'.An order in 'wait' is an active order, waiting fulfillment;a 'done' order is an order fulfilled;'cancel' means the order has been canceled.

volume.description: The amount user want to sell/buy.An order could be partially executed,e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order,left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0',its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.

OrderBook.description: Get the order book of specified market.

contact.name: Oleksandr Papevis CTO of Excoincial Exchange, Head of Support Africunia Bank

info.description: Member API is API which can be used by client application like SPA.
info.title: Member API v2

parameters.description: Currency code.

get.description: Returns deposit address for account you want to deposit to. The address may be blank because address generation process is still in progress. If this case you should try again later.

parameters.description: The account you want to deposit to.
parameters.name: currency

parameters.description: Address format legacy/cash
parameters.name: address_format

200.description: Returns deposit address for account you want to deposit to. The address may be blank because address generation process is still in progress. If this case you should try again later.

parameters.description: Currency value contains afcash,btc,btx,eta,eth,gmc,kit,ltc,reex,tusd,usd,xlmgold,xrp,AFCASH,BTC,BTX,ETA,ETH,GMC,KIT,LTC,REEX,TUSD,USD,XLMGOLD,XRP
parameters.name: currency

parameters.description: Set result limit.
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Get depth or specified market. Both asks and bids are sorted from highest price to lowest.

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned price levels. Default to 300.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: Get depth or specified market. Both asks and bids are sorted from highest price to lowest.

get.description: Get OHLC(k line) of specific market.

parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.
parameters.name: time_from

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data till that time will be returned.
parameters.name: time_to

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points default to 30. Ignored if time_from and time_to are given.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: Get OHLC(k line) of specific market.

get.description: Get K data with pending trades, which are the trades not included in K data yet, because there's delay between trade generated and processed by K data generator.

parameters.description: The trade id of the first trade you received.
parameters.name: trade_id

parameters.description: Time period of K line, default to 1. You can choose between 1, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, 1440, 4320, 10080
parameters.name: period

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data after that time will be returned.
parameters.name: time_from

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only k-line data till that time will be returned.
parameters.name: time_to

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned data points, default to 30.
parameters.name: limit

200.description: Get K data with pending trades, which are the trades not included in K data yet, because there's delay between trade generated and processed by K data generator.

get.description: Get your orders, results is paginated.

parameters.description: Filter order by state, default to 'wait' (active orders).
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned orders, default to 100.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specify the page of paginated results.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: If set, returned orders will be sorted in specific order, default to 'asc'.
parameters.name: order_by

200.description: Get your orders, results is paginated.

parameters.description: If present, only sell orders (asks) or buy orders (bids) will be canncelled.
parameters.name: side

get.description: Get server current time, in seconds since Unix epoch.

200.description: Get server current time, in seconds since Unix epoch.

get.description: Get recent trades on market, each trade is included only once. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned trades. Default to 50.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch. If set, only trades executed before the time will be returned.
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order, default to 'desc'.
parameters.name: order_by

200.description: Get recent trades on market, each trade is included only once. Trades are sorted in reverse creation order.

parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created after the trade will be returned.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Trade id. If set, only trades created before the trade will be returned.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: If set, returned trades will be sorted in specific order, default to 'desc'.
parameters.name: order_by
